p: To isolate monoclonal antibodies from a female rhesus monkey immunized with rHAdV4-GnGcopt after 210 days, we first performed ELISA to measure Gn-specific IgG titers in the rhesus monkey. The Gn-specific IgG titers increased remarkably ( Figure 1A). To this end, we also measured neutralizing antibody titers in the monkey using VNT. Compared with neutralizing antibody titers in the sera collected pre-vaccination, neutralizing antibody titers in the sera collected 210 days post-vaccination increased obviously ( Figure 1B). Taken together, the results indicated that a good level of Gn-specific and neutralizing antibody responses were effectively induced by the rHAdV4-GnGcopt.
